laboratory_examinations.procedure_name: MRI of the right lower limb
laboratory_examinations.findings: Cerebriform connective tissue overgrowth identified on both the plantar and lateral aspects of the right foot. The right foot appeared enlarged. Notable length and size discrepancy between right and left legs. Muscle atrophy in the thigh with hypertrophy of intermuscular and subcutaneous fat planes. Hypertrophy of subcutaneous fat and fatty infiltration within calf muscles. Inward bowing of both fibulas.

laboratory_examinations.procedure_name: Contrast-enhanced angiography and venography of the right lower limb
laboratory_examinations.findings: Enlargement of the right superficial femoral, popliteal, and posterior tibial arteries. Feeders from the posterior tibial artery identified in the lower third of the leg. Prominent vascular channels on the posterolateral aspect of the right leg and foot, along with abnormal vessels within the foot. Dilation in the lower third of superficial femoral and popliteal veins. Prominent long saphenous vein with multiple varicosities on the anterior and lateral aspects of the thigh and the leg.
